name: Steampunk Gothic Horror Romance
description: Complete genre pack for Steampunk Gothic Horror Romance novels featuring Victorian-era steam technology, atmospheric dread, forbidden romance, and industrial beauty merged with decay. Perfect for stories that blend brass and darkness, desire and death, innovation and the supernatural.
author: BQ Studio

genre_characteristics.core_conflict: Balancing desire with propriety, innovation with ethics, humanity with mechanical transformation, while uncovering dark secrets
genre_characteristics.pacing: Slow-burn dread with romantic tension escalation

series_planning: 1. Use steampunk-setting-template.md to establish gothic industrial location (manor/factory/airship)
2. Use steampunk-character-template.md for protagonist and love interest (include transformation status, class, expertise)
3. Define the dark secret/curse/threat that drives the horror
4. Establish Victorian social constraints that complicate romance
5. Plan mechanical/supernatural threat and how it relates to characters
book_planning: 1. Choose beat sheet: gothic-romance-structure.md for horror-heavy, steampunk-mystery-romance.md for investigation-focused
2. Map character wounds and transformation arcs to beat structure
3. Plan secret revelation timing (use information-economy NPE rules)
4. Balance romantic escalation with dread escalation
5. Determine ending type: tragic, dark happy, bittersweet, mechanical immortality
scene_writing: 1. Apply steampunk-gothic-atmosphere.md three-layer technique (Victorian + Industrial + Gothic)
4. Create romantic tension through propriety violations and forbidden proximity
5. Juxtapose beauty and horror in every scene
review: 1. Validate romance-horror balance (neither overwhelming the other)
2. Check Victorian authenticity (social rules, class dynamics, technology limits)
3. Verify atmospheric consistency (dread maintained, mechanical elements present, gothic tone)
4. Validate character logic (transformation acceptance, wound-driven behavior, period-appropriate)
5. Check secret pacing (reveals timed for maximum impact)

content_ratings.violence: medium-to-high (industrial accidents, body horror from mechanical transformation, creature attacks, potential graphic deaths)
content_ratings.heat_level: variable (sweet to explicit depending on author preference; Victorian propriety creates tension regardless of heat level)
content_ratings.language: moderate (Victorian formality with occasional strong language in emotional moments)
trigger_warnings: Potential consent issues (power imbalance, transformation without full consent)

structure.notes: Gothic romance horror often works well as standalones or duets. Trilogies possible if exploring multi-generational curse or series of inventions/transformations. Avoid open-ended series—gothic romance needs closure (even if dark).

notes: This genre pack emphasizes the unique fusion of three elements: Victorian social constraints, steam-powered industrial progress, and gothic atmospheric horror
Romance is complicated by class divide, propriety, mechanical transformation, and dark secrets
Horror comes from body transformation, industrial danger, supernatural threats, and the cost of progress
Atmosphere is critical—every scene should layer Victorian propriety, industrial machinery, and gothic dread
Endings can range from tragic to dark-happy (mechanical immortality together) to bittersweet
Strong emphasis on sensory detail: sound of steam, smell of oil and decay, touch of cold brass, Victorian formality contrasted with mechanical precision
Character wounds typically relate to loss, transformation, class shame, forbidden knowledge, or family curses
Settings function almost as characters—isolating, oppressive, beautiful, and dangerous
character_archetypes: Mechanically-transformed aristocrat seeking redemption or revenge
Engineer uncovering dark family secrets through forbidden science
Governess/companion drawn into gothic household mysteries
Airship captain fleeing or pursuing supernatural threat
Factory owner dealing with consequences of unethical innovation
Scientist whose experiments have monstrous results
common_tropes: The Forbidden Workshop (where protagonist and love interest work together alone)
Mechanical Transformation (becoming part machine, losing humanity, questioning soul)
The Gothic Manor-Factory Hybrid (beauty merged with industrial horror)
Dangerous Invention (creation that kills, transforms, or curses)
Family Curse meets Industrial Progress (ancestral sin expressed through machinery)
Beauty in Brass (mechanical parts that are beautiful but cold, precise but inhuman)
The Ticking Heart (clockwork replacement, constant reminder of transformation)
Fog and Steam (atmospheric concealment, industrial pollution, gothic mist)
The Secret in the Sealed Wing (forbidden knowledge, previous victims, dark experiments)

market_positioning.target_audience: Adult readers who love historical romance with dark elements, steampunk aesthetics, and gothic atmosphere. Fans of Mary Shelley, Gail Carriger's darker works, Meljean Brook's Iron Seas, G.D. Falksen's steampunk gothic.
comp_titles: The Iron Duke by Meljean Brook (steampunk romance with darkness)
Soulless by Gail Carriger (but darker, more gothic)
Boneshaker by Cherie Priest (atmospheric steampunk with horror)
The Inventor's Secret series by Andrea Cremer (YA steampunk gothic)
Crimson Peak (film - gothic romance horror aesthetic)
unique_selling_points: Mechanical transformation as body horror and romance complication
Class conflict enhanced by industrial revolution setting
Slow-burn dread escalation alongside romantic tension
Beauty in decay aesthetic—brass and darkness intertwined
Innovation as both salvation and damnation
reader_expectations: Rich atmospheric description (fog, steam, gaslight, decay)
Forbidden or complicated romance (class, propriety, transformation)
Horror elements (body horror, supernatural, industrial danger)
Sensory immersion (sounds of machinery, smells of oil and roses, cold brass touch)
Endings that may be tragic, dark-happy, or bittersweet—not necessarily HEA
